intro: Asphodelus intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate asphodel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and tall spikes of pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Its flowers bloom from spring to early summer, and it is known for its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions. The plant has been used historically in traditional medicine and as a source of ornamental value.
